text: A body is projected vertically upwards with a speed of 10 ms-1 from a point 2m above the ground. Calculate the total time taken for the body to reach the ground. [g = 10ms-2]
A car starts from rest and covers a distance of 40m in 10s. Calculate the magnitude of its acceleration
The diagram above illustrates a uniform metre rule which is balanced on a pivot by some masses. Calculate the value of M
The period of a simple pendulum X is 5s. What is the period of a simple pendulum Y which makes 50 vibrations in the same time it takes X to make 20 vibrations?
explanation:
It takes X 5s for 1 complete vibration.
⇒ It takes X (5 x 20)s for 20 vibrations.
= 100s.
It takes Y 100s for 50 vibrations.
⇒ The period of Y = \(\frac{100}{50}\)s
= 2s.

A screw-jack has the distance between its successive threads as P and the length of its tommy bar as r. Its velocity ratio is given by the expression
Heat transfer by conduction is similar to wave motion because

options.C: charged particles vibrates at right angles
options.D: no transfer of materials is involved

explanation: Heat transfer by conduction is similar to wave motion because no transfer of materials is involved. In conduction, heat is transferred from molecule to molecule within a substance without moving the substance as a whole. This is similar to wave motion where energy is transferred from particle to particle within the medium without any net movement of the medium itself.

A quantity of water at 20oC is mixed with another quantity of water at 70oC. The final steady temperature of the mixture is 40oC. Determine the ratio of the mass of the cold water to that of the hot water

The mass of an empty density bottle is 30g. When filled with a liquid, the mass of the bottle and the liquid is 40g. On heating the filled bottle through 40ºc, the mass reduces to 38g. Calculate the apparent cubic expansivity of the liquid
explanation: Apparent cubic expansivity = \(\frac{\text{mass of hot liquid expelled}}{\text{mass of hot liquid left x temp. rise}}\)= \(\frac{2}{8 \times 40} = 0.00625\)

A transverse wave can be distinguished from a longitudinal wave by

Refraction of lights differs from reflection in that, in refraction i. at least two media are involved ii. there is a change in the direction of the ray iii. the speed of the ray changes. Which of the statements above is/are correct?
explanation:
At least two media are involved: True for refraction.
There is a change in the direction of the ray: True for both refraction and reflection.
The speed of the ray changes: True only for refraction.
